segments.cn: 两个很好的短语，用于传达坏消息。

segments.en: And why don't we hear them one more time in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不在对话中再听一遍它们呢。

segments.en: Now that we've been over the gory details of our disastrous first quarter, Ed, give us some good news.
segments.cn: 现在我们已经讨论了我们灾难性的第一季度的可怕细节，埃德，给我们一些好消息。

segments.en: How are things looking for us in terms of sales this month?
segments.cn: 这个月我们的销售情况如何？

segments.en: Well, would you like the bad news first or the really bad news?
segments.cn: 嗯，你想先听坏消息还是更坏的消息？

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: Ed, don't tell me you only have bad news.
segments.cn: 埃德，别告诉我你只有坏消息。

segments.en: Well, sir, our sales have dropped.
segments.cn: 嗯，先生，我们的销售额下降了。

segments.en: No plunged.
segments.cn: 不，是暴跌。

segments.en: 50% in the past month alone.
segments.cn: 在过去一个月中下降了50%。

segments.en: We are currently overstocked and overstaffed and our profits are falling fast.
segments.cn: 我们目前库存过剩，员工过多，利润正在快速下降。

segments.en: The market is in recession and we have no way of moving our inventory or getting rid of our staff.
segments.cn: 市场正在衰退，我们没有办法处理我们的库存或裁员。

segments.en: If we consider redundancies, it would cost us a fortune because of the new regulations governing compensation packages.
segments.cn: 如果考虑裁员，按照新规定，赔偿费用将会非常高。

segments.en: It's a real mess.
segments.cn: 这真是一团糟。

segments.en: You're coming out loud.
segments.cn: 你说得很响。

segments.en: How fast are we losing money?
segments.cn: 我们损失得有多快？

segments.en: Um, um, how can I put this?
segments.cn: 嗯，嗯，我该怎么说呢？

segments.en: Let's just say that at this pace, we will be filing for Chapter 11 in less than three months.
segments.cn: 就这样说吧，照这个速度，我们将在不到三个月内申请破产保护。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: Jeez, how could this have happened?
segments.cn: 天哪，怎么会发生这种事？

segments.en: So what's the bad news?
segments.cn: 那坏消息是什么？

segments.en: Oh, that's the really bad news.
segments.cn: 哦，那真是个坏消息。

segments.en: Our suppliers suffered QC problems and, well, half of our production is faulty.
segments.cn: 我们的供应商出现了质量控制问题，结果我们一半的产品有缺陷。

segments.en: We're going to have to recall all items sold in the last quarter and the worst part?
segments.cn: 我们将不得不召回上个季度销售的所有商品，最糟糕的是？

segments.en: We're going to have to shoulder this cost.
segments.cn: 我们得承担这笔费用。

segments.en: Are you joking?
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吗？

segments.en: Get the supplier on the line now.
segments.cn: 现在就把供应商叫过来。

segments.en: They have to assume the cost of this mess.
segments.cn: 他们必须承担这场混乱的费用。

segments.en: We tried that, sir.
segments.cn: 我们试过了，先生。

segments.en: The factory has gone under and the owner apparently has fled the country.
segments.cn: 工厂已经倒闭，老板显然已经逃离了国家。

segments.en: Oh, we're doomed.
segments.cn: 哦，我们完蛋了。

segments.en: There is some really good news, though.
segments.cn: 不过有一些好消息。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: I got offered a new job.
segments.cn: 我收到了一个新工作的邀请。

segments.en: Alright, great.
segments.cn: 好吧，太好了。

segments.en: So this topic of filing for Chapter 11 is actually very recent, very common now because recently one of the biggest companies filed for Chapter 11 in the US.
segments.cn: 所以申请破产保护这个话题其实很新，也很常见，因为最近美国最大的公司之一申请了破产保护。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: But I often get confused by the phrase to file for Chapter 11 versus to file for Chapter 13.
segments.cn: 但我常常搞不清楚申请破产保护第11章和第13章的区别。

segments.en: Alright, so in the United States the bankruptcy law has different chapters or different sections, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，在美国，破产法有不同的章节或部分，对吧？

segments.en: And Chapter 11 is basically for companies that run out of money, that go bankrupt, so they have to declare themselves in bankruptcy.
segments.cn: 第11章基本上是针对资金耗尽、破产的公司，所以他们必须申请破产。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And so they file for Chapter 11.
segments.cn: 所以他们申请第11章。

segments.en: But what about Chapter 13?
segments.cn: 那第13章呢？

segments.en: Chapter 13 is for people.
segments.cn: 第13章是针对个人的。

segments.en: Ah, okay.
segments.cn: 啊，明白了。

segments.en: So people who have large debts maybe with the car company or the telephone company and they can't pay, they file for Chapter 13.
segments.cn: 所以那些有大额债务的人，比如汽车公司或电话公司，无法偿还的，他们申请第13章。

segments.en: They say, hey, I don't have money, I can't pay.
segments.cn: 他们会说，嘿，我没钱，我还不了。

segments.en: Alright, so I guess here it's kind of a metaphor again.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这里又是一个隐喻。

segments.en: You know, it's this phrase to file for Chapter 11 or Chapter 13 meaning bankruptcy.
segments.cn: 你知道，申请第11章或第13章的短语意味着破产。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And people will say personally that they're filing for Chapter 11.
segments.cn: 人们会说他们个人申请第11章。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Right, so this is an interesting situation because if you file for bankruptcy in some countries you can go to jail.
segments.cn: 对，所以这是一个有趣的情况，因为在某些国家申请破产可能会入狱。

segments.en: Ah, I read recently about this happening in Dubai actually.
segments.cn: 啊，我最近读到在迪拜发生过这种事。

segments.en: Exactly, so there is prison for debts.
segments.cn: 确切地说，确实有因债务入狱的情况。

segments.en: In the US you don't go to prison for debts.
segments.cn: 在美国，因债务不会入狱。

segments.en: But what about in your countries, listeners?
segments.cn: 但在你们的国家呢，听众们？

segments.en: What happens when you go into debt in your country?
segments.cn: 在你们的国家，负债后会发生什么？

segments.en: Or what happens when a company goes into bankruptcy?
segments.cn: 或者公司破产后会发生什么？

segments.cn: 当然，Erica和我会一直在这里帮助你。
